content.prompt:
© British Library Board / Robana / Art Resource, NY

The cross-carpet page of the Lindisfarne Gospels demonstrates both continuity and change through the use of

choices.label: indigenous styles to express new religious meaning
religious imagery in a secular manuscript to appeal to a wider audience
classical references to serve a propagandistic purpose
cloisonné enamel in lavish manuscript production to increase its worth

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.2: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 4.D: Explain the meaning or significance of continuity and/or change between works of art (or groups of related works of art) within a related artistic tradition, style, or practice.
